actionUnits.condition: Awaiting the attached MonoBehaviour component settings (m_Calls) or the presence of Collider/EventTrigger on --INTERACTABLE--. The provided scene meta shows only a Transform (fileID 1782057476), Has_Rigidbody=false, no Collider and no EventTrigger. Once the MonoBehaviour with public no-arg methods and its m_Calls are available, we will trigger those events. Note: In Unity scene files, the MonoBehaviour component represents the serialized settings of the script attached to the GameObject.

Trigger XR Interactable m_Activated persistent calls defined in the MonoBehaviour (scene-serialized m_Calls) on Launcher_DartGun. This will invoke LaunchProjectile.Fire (MonoBehaviour id 763022186) and PlayQuickSound.Play (MonoBehaviour id 763022189). The MonoBehaviour components here are the serialized settings of the attached scripts.

Invoke XR Interactor m_Activated persistent calls serialized in the MonoBehaviour (scene meta m_Calls) on Launcher_DartGun. This triggers LaunchProjectile.Fire (MonoBehaviour id 763022186) to Instantiate the projectile and PlayQuickSound.Play (MonoBehaviour id 763022189). The MonoBehaviour components listed are the serialized settings of attached scripts.

Invoke XR Interactor m_Activated persistent calls (scene meta m_Calls) on Launcher_DartGun. These MonoBehaviour components are the serialized settings of the attached scripts. Expected: LaunchProjectile.Fire (script id 763022186) instantiates Projectile_Dart and PlayQuickSound.Play (script id 763022189) plays audio.

Call public no-arg methods on PlaySoundsFromList (MonoBehaviour id 1734837741). MonoBehaviour components listed are the serialized settings of the attached scripts. No m_Calls configured for audio; manual trigger ensures coverage of playback and index change.

Simulate XR HoverExited on Light_Switch. MonoBehaviour component (id 1768355684) is the serialized settings of the XR Interaction Toolkit script attached to this GameObject. MonoBehaviour (fileID 628911205, m_Script guid acbdb9f0a1fd00f44bf08cc79a3c9bfb) is the serialized settings of the attached script TeleportAnchorWithFade on StartingPoint. This class overrides XR Interaction Toolkit callbacks and runs FadeSequence when m_TeleportTrigger matches. Scene meta shows m_TeleportTrigger=0 (interpreted as TeleportTrigger.OnSelectEntered). Simulate a Select Entered interaction on StartingPoint so TeleportAnchorWithFade.Awake finds FadeCanvas, then OnSelectEntered triggers FadeSequence: FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> wait for fadeCanvas.CurrentRoutine -> base.OnSelectEntered (teleport) -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut. Note: No UnityEvent m_Calls are configured; no Collider/Rigidbody present, but Trigger is allowed due to XR Interaction script using UnityEvent fields.

Simulate XR Select Enter on TeleportationAnchor (TeleportAnchorWithFade). This path runs when teleportTrigger == OnSelectEntered, invoking FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> TeleportationAnchor.OnSelectEntered -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut. Requires the TeleportAnchorWithFade MonoBehaviour component fileID and confirmation of Collider/EventTrigger presence.

Simulate XR Select Exit on TeleportationAnchor (TeleportAnchorWithFade). This path runs when teleportTrigger == OnSelectExited, invoking FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> TeleportationAnchor.OnSelectExited -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut. Requires the TeleportAnchorWithFade MonoBehaviour component fileID and confirmation of Collider/EventTrigger presence.

Simulate XR Activation on TeleportationAnchor (TeleportAnchorWithFade). This path runs when teleportTrigger == OnActivated, invoking FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> TeleportationAnchor.OnActivated -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut. Requires the TeleportAnchorWithFade MonoBehaviour component fileID and confirmation of Collider/EventTrigger presence.

Simulate XR Deactivation on TeleportationAnchor (TeleportAnchorWithFade). This path runs when teleportTrigger == OnDeactivated, invoking FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> TeleportationAnchor.OnDeactivated -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut. Requires the TeleportAnchorWithFade MonoBehaviour component fileID and confirmation of Collider/EventTrigger presence.

Directly invoke Play() on PlayQuickSound MonoBehaviour to cover audio playback path (requires AudioSource due to [RequireComponent], and object should be active). Confirm the component fileID for PlayQuickSound (likely 1865680030 from m_AddedComponents) and presence of a Collider/EventTrigger or allowance for direct method invocation by the test harness.

RightHand Controller has SphereCollider (fileID 474225664, isTrigger=1) and MonoBehaviour (fileID 474225666) configured from script guid 4a8d337e8bc7ac4498e0df29e7b8bd5e (OnButtonPress). MonoBehaviour component (fileID 172617727) is the serialized settings of the attached script ToggleRay (m_Script fileID 11500000, guid cf14522d53cc1594991c164e785780dc) on LeftHand Ray Controller. Serialized fields: forceToggle=0, directInteractor=fileID 235308789. To ensure ActivateRay toggles, the directInteractor must have no valid targets (TouchingObject() == false). This test manually triggers the public no-parameter methods ActivateRay and DeactivateRay to cover the switching logic (rayInteractor.enabled and directInteractor.enabled).

MonoBehaviour component (fileID 1287520551) is the serialized settings of the attached script ToggleRay (m_Script fileID 11500000, guid cf14522d53cc1594991c164e785780dc) on RightHand Ray Controller. Serialized fields: forceToggle=0, directInteractor=fileID 474225665. Awake() already executed at runtime to set rayInteractor.enabled=false via SwitchInteractors(false). Ensure XRDirectInteractor (fileID 474225665) has no valid targets at trigger time so ActivateRay toggles on (TouchingObject()==false).

MonoBehaviour component id=631718164 (m_Script guid=474bcb49853aa07438625e644c072ee6) is treated as the settings for the attached TeleportAnchorWithFade script. To exercise the fade-and-teleport sequence on selection, configure TeleportationAnchor.teleportTrigger = OnSelectEntered and simulate a Select Enter on the interactable. Expected behavior: FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> wait until fadeCanvas.CurrentRoutine completes -> base.OnSelectEntered(args) performs teleport -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut.

MonoBehaviour component id=631718164 (TeleportAnchorWithFade settings). Configure TeleportationAnchor.teleportTrigger = OnSelectExited and simulate a Select Exit on the interactable. Expected behavior: FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> wait -> base.OnSelectExited(args) -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut.

MonoBehaviour component id=631718164 (TeleportAnchorWithFade settings). Configure TeleportationAnchor.teleportTrigger = OnActivated and simulate an Activate event on the interactable. Expected behavior: FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> wait -> base.OnActivated(args) -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut.

MonoBehaviour component id=631718164 (TeleportAnchorWithFade settings). Configure TeleportationAnchor.teleportTrigger = OnDeactivated and simulate a Deactivate event on the interactable. Expected behavior: FadeCanvas.QuickFadeIn -> wait -> base.OnDeactivated(args) -> FadeCanvas.QuickFadeOut.

Manual invocation of ToggleParticle public methods to start particle emission. With particle system currently stopped, ToggleParticleSystem() should start it.
With particle system currently playing from prior toggle, ToggleParticleSystem() should stop it, covering both branches.

Precondition: Add any Collider (e.g., SphereCollider with isTrigger=true) to Particle_Flame so Trigger interactions are permitted. Scene MonoBehaviour (component id: 5377429380903153772) uses m_Script guid ad0a2892d8b703341afc39a5cf89bef8, which is the attached ToggleParticle script. ParticleSystem (playOnAwake=0 per prefab/OnValidate) exists; first toggle should start playback.
Ensure the same MonoBehaviour (id 5377429380903153772, guid ad0a2892d8b703341afc39a5cf89bef8 - ToggleParticle) remains enabled. This call verifies Play() is safe when already playing.
Same component (id 5377429380903153772, guid ad0a2892d8b703341afc39a5cf89bef8 - ToggleParticle). This call stops the particle system to cover Stop() code path.

Manual audio trigger required because playOnStart == 0 on MonoBehaviour (script_fileID: 1478742632, guid: 0ab6d3e7b225a7342a0d702b6151692b). No Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger found; invoke public no-arg methods on the attached script to validate playback and volume behavior.

MonoBehaviour_0 (id: 1633495861) in scene meta corresponds to script PhoneRingScreen (m_Script guid: 036aa4c6ab8e55144a03e8aefc6e9cca). PhoneRingScreen updates the phone screen material based on AudioSource.isPlaying: calling_material (guid: 8669b00696550574cb2f5a0480bbc344) when playing, original_material when not. To achieve full coverage, we need a way to toggle the AudioSource playback state (start/stop) via a public, parameterless method or configured m_Calls/EventTrigger. No public methods are exposed in PhoneRingScreen, and no m_Calls are present in the provided meta, so this trigger is a placeholder awaiting an event to invoke AudioSource.Play/Stop or a wrapper method.
